page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: In Bilsthorpe the village is split into 2 halves, the original settlement around the Church and the newer half built from 1928 onwards. The older part is mostly farms and building of red brick and pantile roofs. 6 semi-detached council houses, the rest are mostly new detached houses. In the newer half there are 2 major housing estates, one built by the Coal Board and the other by the Council. These are mainly 3 bedroomed semi-detached houses with some Old Age Bungalows. A Caravan Site is situated at the edge of the village. There has been a steady increase in home ownership. In Eakring the houses are mainly detached red brick and pantile roofs. There is a council estate of 47 semi-detached houses plus 6 bungalows which were built in 1947. Very little new housing has taken place.
